content.data: Optimizer Parameters
image1262.gif
There are three tabs in the Saw Optimization Optimize Properties screen:
Patterns Tab
image292.gif

The Save option here will 
 allow you to Save any changes made in this area directly to your selected 
 Primary Machine in the Machine Catalog.
image1264.gif
Following are the options in the Patterns Tab:

You 
	 can control whether you want your first cut on the saw to be a Rip 
	 (Cut with the grain), a Cross Cut (Cut across the grain), or Either. 
 You 
	 can control how you want your Strips sorted. The image below has 2 
	 Strip sets, the vertical containing a single strip and the horizontal 
	 containing 5 strips.

You 
	 can control whether you want your first cut on the saw to be a Rip 
	 (Cut with the grain), a Cross Cut (Cut across the grain), or Either.

You 
	 can control whether you want your first cut on the saw to be a Rip 
	 (Cut with the grain), a Cross Cut (Cut across the grain), or Either.

You 
	 can control how you want your Strips sorted. The image below has 2 
	 Strip sets, the vertical containing a single strip and the horizontal 
	 containing 5 strips.

You 
	 can control how you want your Strips sorted. The image below has 2 
	 Strip sets, the vertical containing a single strip and the horizontal 
	 containing 5 strips.
image446.jpg

A Strip is single element from a Strip Set. 
 A Strip will always have Cross-Cuts or (Y-Cuts) and possibly Z-Cuts.
image447.jpg

All the cuts that produce a part on this 
 pattern are Y-Cuts except the Z-Cut displayed in red. A Y-Cut or Cross-Cut 
 runs in the opposite direction of a strip producing either a Part or setting 
 up to produce a Part.

You 
	 can control how you want your Parts within the each Strip to be sorted.

You 
	 can control how you want your Parts within the each Strip to be sorted.

You 
	 can control how you want your Parts within the each Strip to be sorted.

Yield 
	 and Labor are used to determine how well the job will be booked. A 
	 selection of Labor would favor fewer cycles over Material optimization. 
	 A selection of Yield would favor less Material over fewer cycles.

Yield 
	 and Labor are used to determine how well the job will be booked. A 
	 selection of Labor would favor fewer cycles over Material optimization. 
	 A selection of Yield would favor less Material over fewer cycles.

Yield 
	 and Labor are used to determine how well the job will be booked. A 
	 selection of Labor would favor fewer cycles over Material optimization. 
	 A selection of Yield would favor less Material over fewer cycles.

Make certain to set 
 up  Booking  
 for your Saw in the Machine Catalog Setup Tab.
Information.png

You 
	 can eliminate Z-Cuts. A Z-Cut is the “Third Phase” cut on any given 
	 strip. A “Z-Cut” and “Third Phase Cut” are the same as long as they 
	 are cut from the 1st strip set in a pattern. However, we allow the 
	 strip series to change directions a maximum of 6 times, the Z-Cut 
	 could occur on the 3rd, 4th, 5th,6th, 7th, or 8th phase. Allowing 
	 Z-Cuts can cause a dramatic improvement in Yield but at the cost of 
	 time spent on the Saw. This can cause the operator to make multiple 
	 cuts to bring a part to its finished size.

You 
	 can eliminate Z-Cuts. A Z-Cut is the “Third Phase” cut on any given 
	 strip. A “Z-Cut” and “Third Phase Cut” are the same as long as they 
	 are cut from the 1st strip set in a pattern. However, we allow the 
	 strip series to change directions a maximum of 6 times, the Z-Cut 
	 could occur on the 3rd, 4th, 5th,6th, 7th, or 8th phase. Allowing 
	 Z-Cuts can cause a dramatic improvement in Yield but at the cost of 
	 time spent on the Saw. This can cause the operator to make multiple 
	 cuts to bring a part to its finished size.

You 
	 can eliminate Z-Cuts. A Z-Cut is the “Third Phase” cut on any given 
	 strip. A “Z-Cut” and “Third Phase Cut” are the same as long as they 
	 are cut from the 1st strip set in a pattern. However, we allow the 
	 strip series to change directions a maximum of 6 times, the Z-Cut 
	 could occur on the 3rd, 4th, 5th,6th, 7th, or 8th phase. Allowing 
	 Z-Cuts can cause a dramatic improvement in Yield but at the cost of 
	 time spent on the Saw. This can cause the operator to make multiple 
	 cuts to bring a part to its finished size.
image443.jpg

Eliminating Z-Cuts will 
 affect the type of patterns that are generated but it will not reduce 
 the phase count. Make certain to set up the Phase Count for your Saw in 
 the Machine Catalog Setup Tab.
Information.png

You 
	 can eliminate T-Cuts.

You 
	 can eliminate T-Cuts.

You 
	 can eliminate T-Cuts.

T-Cuts are cuts made 
 to break a sheet apart prior to Ripping and/or Cross-Cutting. Allowing 
 T-Cuts can cause an improvement in Yield but like Third Phase Cuts can 
 also cost time spent on the Saw.
Information.png

You 
	 can control the Quality of your Optimization. Moving the slider to 
	 the Right improves the results of the Optimization. 
 With Offcut/Waste Order you 
	 can set whether you want them cut First or Last.

You 
	 can control the Quality of your Optimization. Moving the slider to 
	 the Right improves the results of the Optimization.

You 
	 can control the Quality of your Optimization. Moving the slider to 
	 the Right improves the results of the Optimization.

With Offcut/Waste Order you 
	 can set whether you want them cut First or Last.

With Offcut/Waste Order you 
	 can set whether you want them cut First or Last.
Restrictions Tab
image293.gif
There are two main option in the Restrictions Tab:

You 
	 can control the Minimum and Maximum Strip Lengths and Widths the Optimization 
	 returns. Some Saws have limitations, this allows you to instruct the 
	 S2M Center Optimizer on your Saws limitations. 
 You 
	 can control the Minimum and Maximum T-Cuts Lengths and Widths the 
	 Optimization returns. Some Saws have limitations, this allows you 
	 to instruct the S2M Center Optimizer on your Saws limitations.

You 
	 can control the Minimum and Maximum Strip Lengths and Widths the Optimization 
	 returns. Some Saws have limitations, this allows you to instruct the 
	 S2M Center Optimizer on your Saws limitations.

You 
	 can control the Minimum and Maximum Strip Lengths and Widths the Optimization 
	 returns. Some Saws have limitations, this allows you to instruct the 
	 S2M Center Optimizer on your Saws limitations.

You 
	 can control the Minimum and Maximum T-Cuts Lengths and Widths the 
	 Optimization returns. Some Saws have limitations, this allows you 
	 to instruct the S2M Center Optimizer on your Saws limitations.

You 
	 can control the Minimum and Maximum T-Cuts Lengths and Widths the 
	 Optimization returns. Some Saws have limitations, this allows you 
	 to instruct the S2M Center Optimizer on your Saws limitations.
Trim Tab
image294.gif
There is one main option in the Waste/Trim Tab:

You 
	 can control the width of Trim (Dust Cut) around each edge of your 
	 sheet.

You 
	 can control the width of Trim (Dust Cut) around each edge of your 
	 sheet.

You 
	 can control the width of Trim (Dust Cut) around each edge of your 
	 sheet.
